intro: Coccoceras, commonly known as the "sea lettuce," is a type of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its flat, blade-like structure and is typically found in marine environments, especially in shallow coastal waters. The plant consists of a single layer of cells, making it a simple multicellular organism. Coccoceras reproduces through both sexual and asexual means, often forming dense mats on rocky substrates. It plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
